Hi...

is it possible to mark a testmethod A to depend on (or to be execute=
d after)
a testmethod B? Probably by a specific annotation or something els=
e?

I'd want to use it in cases where I my class-under-test as a crucial bu=
t
complex method like the constructor. In this case, I would mark some of t=
he
other test-methods to rely on the constructor-tests. If the
constructor-=
tests fail, the depending tests should be skipped, because a
failing of the=
se tests has no significance and make it difficult to find the
real error.
=

  Stefan
